intro: Serruria confragosa, commonly known as the Cape rose or African rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its distinctive pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with small, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Serruria confragosa is well adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
